description: A set of questions to test the software with
name: Loadmaster All (May 2018)

questions.question: 1. To override the #2 or #3 hydraulic aux pumps for an auto shutdown due to low quantity or overheat,
responses: Press and hold appropriate Aux pump switch for 5 seconds
Press and hold XFER pump switch for 5 seconds
Press and hold appropriate Aux pump switch for 3 seconds
Press and hold XFER pump switch for 3 seconds

questions.question: 2. When the APU alert start feature is used, there will be no until the Battery Bus is powered.
3. The Battery Direct Bus, the Battery Bus, the AC and DC Emergency Buses, and the AC and DC Transfer Buses comprise the _____.

4. To preclude damage to the landing gear, accomplish no more than _____ consecutive landings without a cooling period. A cooling period consists of, flying with the gear retracted for at least 20 minutes or with the gear extended for at least 10 minutes before the next landing.
5. To determine an individual aircraft's maximum payload _____.
responses: subtract Operating Weight from Maximum Takeoff Weight
subtract Ramp Fuel Weight from Maximum Takeoff Weight
subtract Operating Weight from Maximum Zero Fuel Weight
subtract Operating weight from Basic Aircraft Weight

questions.question: 6. Following an intentional cabin depressurization above 10,000 feet, the cabin must be repressurized to less than _____ feet to reset the regulators. If the regulators are not reset, subsequent flight above 9,000 feet cabin altitude may deploy the passenger oxygen masks.

7. Below _____ feet cabin altitude, each emergency oxygen regulator SURGE MODE lever/three position toggle switch must be positioned to MAN ON/MANUAL ON position to ensure regulated oxygen is provided to passengers.

8. The passenger oxygen masks can be manually deployed at any altitude with the -1 emergency oxygen regulator by positioning the SURGE MODE lever to the MAN ON position , and rotating the spring loaded surge knob _____ and holding momentarily (approximately _____ seconds) to open the passenger oxygen	 	 containers and start the flow of oxygen.
9. If either the pilot's or loadmaster's FED ARM switch is in ARM, all four FEDS hatches can be deployed from either the _____ initiator handles.
responses: pilots overhead panel or the aft left loadmaster station
pilots overhead panel or the maintenance/ditching hatch
forward loadmaster station or the aft left loadmaster station
maintenance/ditching hatch or the forward loadmaster station

questions.question: 10. Portable hand fire extinguishers are provided in the following areas; _____ in the Cockpit, _____ in the Crew rest area, and _____ in the Cargo compartment.
11. The EEBD is a _____-minute self-contained, disposable breathing unit. There are _____ installed on the aircraft.
12. If the aircraft is powered by batteries alone and the pilot's CNC indicates OFF, radio communication is possible using the _____ radio with the VHF/UHF Backup Control panel.
responses: VHF radio with the VHF/UHF Backup Control panel.

questions.question: 13. During AE miss ions, t he loadmaster advises the medical crew director that seat belts are required ________ .

14. The purge valve on the Legacy flight crew quick -don mask should be in the _____ position except during preflight and when oxygen is in use where smoke or fumes are not present and goggles are not required.
15. During in-flight operation of the troop doors, deploy the air deflector between _____ and ____ degrees before opening the first door.
16. When on/offloading vehicles, do not deflate vehicle pneumatic tires _________.
responses: to reduce the need for shoring
below the tires rated inflation pressure

questions.question: 17. Equipment mounted on a single axle loaded with its tongue resting on the aircraft floor or ramp____________.
responses: may be transported with fuel in tank not to exceed 1/2 tank
may be transported with fuel in tank not to exceed 3/4 tank

questions.question: 18. When the vehicle is parked on the cargo floor and parking brakes are inoperative, _____.
responses: install a minimum of one chock, aft of the tires
install a minimum of two chocks, one forward and one aft of the tires
install a minimum of two chains and two tiedown devices, one forward and one aft
install a minimum of one chain to prevent the vehicle from rolling out of the aircraft

questions.question: 19. When loading pallets with a bare tine forklift, one set of inner roller channels may be removed from the ramp toes if the pallet weight does not exceed _____ pounds.
20. Except where prohibited by specific procedures, open circuit breakers _____ in the event that the electrical condition was transient in nature.
responses: may be reset once an hour

questions.question: 21. If both left and right side FEDS Shielded Mild Detonating Cord (SMDC) lines are inoperative (AA -EM w/o TCTO 1549), limit persons on board to a maximum of _____ when mission segments involve overwater flight.
22. The signal for prepare for ditching or crash landing is
responses: 3 short rings of the alarm bell
3 long rings of the alarm bell
6 short rings of the alarm bell
6 long rings of the alarm bell

questions.question: 23. All odors not identifiable by the flight crew shall be considered toxic. Immediately ____.
responses: descend to below FL250 and decrease airspeed.
use 100% oxygen, ventilate the aircraft, and land as soon as practical.
have the loadmaster inspect all cargo for leaks and consider using 100% oxygen.
depress the DROP switchlight twice and direct passengers to use oxygen masks.

questions.question: 24. Following a ditching emergency, as a minimum, the loadmaster will provide _____.
responses: a classified data case and igloo
a first aid kit and igloo
a flashlight and classified data case.
a flashlight and first aid kit

questions.question: 25. If a fire is being fed by oxygen from an oxygen system, consider turning off the ____ until the fire is suppressed.
26. Selective freefall of any landing gear can be accomplished by activating the release handles only for those gear that are not extended. When lowering both main gear on one side, lower ____.
27. The maximum vertical height of a load to be jettisoned is ____ inches measured from the ____ of the pallet/platform.
28. During cargo jettison, ensure all selected lock annunciators are ____ before stating "LOCKS RELEASED".
29. During a ditching, do not activate ____ prior to the aircraft coming to a rest as life rafts may be lost.
30. The maximum cargo weight that can be loaded left or right of aircraft center line is _____ pounds, provided all aircraft limitations are complied with.

31. Do not use _____ cargo compartment lighting in flight. PA system speakers/volume will be deactivated during any condition that activates the cargo compartment lights because of sidewall oxygen system deployment. The speakers/volume must be manually reactivated to make PA announcements.

32. With ambient temperatures are at or below - 9 °C (15 °F), the AUX pumps may not initially generate full pressure. If system pressure does not rise to at least 3500 psi within 30 seconds of selecting the pump to AUTO, select the pump to off, wait 30 seconds and proceed as follows.1. Select the AUX pump to AUTO for 30 seconds, then off for 30 seconds.2. Repeat _____ or until system pressure indicates at least 3500 psi.
33. If a centerline seat assembly cannot be secured with _____ serviceable floor attachment fittings that seat module shall not be installed.
34. If nonstandard cargo/equipment is presented for airlift and an air transportability certification from AFLCMC/EZFC (ATTLA) does not accompany the load, these items _____.
responses: may be loaded provided they do not exceed the limitations/procedures in the -9
shall not be loaded under any circumstances
may be loaded so long as you do not have passengers manifested

questions.question: 35. Vehicle single axle weights equal to or greater than ____ pounds must be loaded within 8 inches of the aircraft centerline in compartments D, F and G.
36. Vehicle single axle weights equal to or greater than ____ pounds must be loaded within 8 inches of the aircraft centerline in compartment E.
37. The maximum vehicle weight of a tracked vehicle with articulated suspension loaded in E compartment is ____
38. Tracked vehicles with articulated suspension and with wheel weights exceeding _____ lbs (average) must be loaded within 8 inches of aircraft centerline.
39. Tunner loader furnished bridge plates shall not be used when loading/offloading rolling stock from a K - loader with the ramp toes installed.
40. Hazardous cargo considered jettisonable _____ be positioned forward of non- jettisonable cargo, except when its size, weight, and location will permit jettison by hand.

41. _____ highlight essential operating procedure, practice, condition or statement, etc which if not strictly observed could result in damage to, or destruction of equipment or loss of mission effectiveness.
42. When cargo projects aft of the end of the logistics rails (FS _____ ), ensure the ramp toes do not contact the cargo while being raised to the vertical position.
43. When pedestal shoring is used under the Ramp Ground Support Pad for special loads, the shoring shall be a minimum of _____ inches long and _____ inches wide.
44. The aft end of the ramp toes shall not be supported when in the _____ position.
responses: the ramp toe shall never be supported 13

questions.question: 45. When winching a vehicle with pneumatic tires up the cargo ramp at a 15 degree angle, a single line winching configuration has a limit of _____ pounds.
46. When winching and the direction of pull is changed, the sheave ______.
responses: can be realigned with the RWC
will automatically realign to the new direction
is realigned by selecting the #3 hydraulic pump to ON
must be manually realigned to the new direction

questions.question: 47. In flight, the ramp toes will be _____.
responses: installed and raised to the up (vertical overcenter) position
stowed on the cargo door or installed and raised to the up (vertical overcenter) position

questions.question: 48. Palletized seat assemblies may be loaded in the logistic rails when transported as cargo. Passengers will not occupy palletized seats in the logistic rails.
49. On aeromedical evacuation missions with litter or ambulatory patients, the ramp is restricted _____.
responses: to loose baggage and floor loaded items only
to two pallets in the left or right logistic rails
to two pallets in the ADS rails or centerline floor loaded items

questions.question: 50. Pallets or pallet trains up to _____ lbs per pallet may be loaded into the logistics rail/lock system s provided	 at least one lock left and one right are engaged in each pallet.
51. The ramp loadable height capability varies between _____ at the ramp hinge to _____ inches at the end of the ramp.
52. Spotters are required to observe clearances and to prevent contact with the wing box structure when loading cargo higher than _____ inches forward of FS _____.
53. When loading ISU containers that are 90 inches or higher into the logistic rails on the aircraft ramp, _____.
responses: jack the aircraft until the ramp height is greater than 68 inches
all vertical restrain shall be achieved using chain type tiedown
ramp toes with rollers and guide rails shall be installed

questions.question: 54. The primary method of loading pallets into the ADS and logistic rail system is using the ramp toes.
55. If _____ are not used, Ramirez 40K and Emerson 25K -loaders must be backed -in when preparing to load/unload cargo into the logistic rail system.

56. Required restraint for cargo on the pallet/pallet train shall be provided using nets, tiedown straps, or chains. When supplemental restraint is required, additional tiedowns may be attached to the pallet or cargo floor.

57. Straps and chains shall not be mixed to restrain cargo in the same direction. However, 10,000 and 25,000 pound rated devices with the appropriate chains may be used for a given direction of restraint.
58. Netted two pallet trains that exceed _____ shall be restrained to the cargo floor.
59. Pallets or pallet trains up to 7,800 pounds per pallet may be loaded into the ADS rail/lock system when ______
responses: at least one lock left and one right are engaged in each pallet.
at least two locks left and two right are engaged in each pallet.
all longitudinal restraint is attached to the cargo floor.
additional longitudinal restraint is attached to the cargo floor.

questions.question: 60. Ensure the cargo is restrained for _____ prior to raising and closing the ramp when cargo is positioned on the ramp for flight.
61. When properly installed on a single pallet, the nets provide all the necessary restraint for cargo loads up to _____ pounds when the height of stacked cargo does not exceed 96 inches.
62. The maximum wheel load on each ramp toe in the low position is _____ pounds.
63. The maximum pallet/platform weight on two ramp toes is _____ pounds except for 18- foot type VI platforms which may be increased to 14,500 pounds.
64. The maximum single axle load on the toes in the low position is _____ pounds.
65. Vehicles with transmissions that are not equipped with a neutral position shall be loaded/offloaded using the cargo winch.
66. Two or three pallet train weight for cargo secured with nets and stacked to 96 inches shall not exceed _____ pounds.
67. Two or three pallet train weight for cargo secured with nets and stacked above 96 inches (not to exceed 100 inches) shall not exceed _____ pounds.
68. All vehicle winching must be closely monitored by a crew of at least _____ personnel.

69. When low profile cargo does not permit the use of side nets, the top net may be used by itself provided the cargo weight does not exceed _____ pounds and cargo height does not exceed _____ inches from the pallet surface.

70. When plywood barriers and chain bridles are installed for forward restraint on palletized cargo, pallets that exceed _____ inches in height will have a minimum of _____ bridle(s) installed and the minimum	 	 thickness for the barrier will be _____ inches.
71. If _____ stowage pins are not engaged on side of each toe stowed on the cargo door, that toe may come loose during flight.
72. If not carefully monitored, MHE may contact the aircraft ________ while positioning pallets/platforms for loading into the logistic rail system.

73. To maintain continuous cable tension , while winching, it may be necessary to physically _________ the vehicle/item aft when traversing the main floor/ramp hinge while the loadmaster gradually unwinds the 	 	 	 20
74. Empty 463L pallets may be stacked for airlift up to a maximum of ____ pallets, excluding the base support pallet.
75. During palletized cargo loading (non –winching), the minimum distance between the aircraft ramp/toes and K - loader is _____ inches.
76. Damage may occur if cargo that spans from the main floor to the ramp is not ________or sufficiently slackened.
77. The minimum thickness of rolling shoring shall be _____ inch(es).
78. With the ramp toes in the high position, the required overlap between the ramp toe contact pads and the floor of the loader is _____ inches.
79. In the high position the ramp toes should be at an angle which causes the aft end of the toe to be above coplanar position with the ramp floor.
80. Each tiedown ring can accommodate up to _____ CGU-1/B tiedown straps for any directional pull calculations.
81. When attaching multiple devices to one tiedown ring, the ring _____.
responses: can be used for restraint in only one direction
can be used for restraint in only two directions
cannot be used for both forward and aft restraint
cannot be used for both vertical and lateral restraint

questions.question: 82. Assure that a minimum of _____ turns of strap is wound around ratchet spool to prevent slippage of 5K pounds capacity strap.
83. Crewmembers occupying a crew station will have an oxygen mask connected and readily available for use from _____.
responses: before engine start until engine shutdown.
after engine start until engine shutdown

questions.question: 84. Crewmembers may travel as MEP for a maximum of _____ hours.
85. When children under the age of _____ are accepted as passengers, their sponsor has the option to either hold the child or place him/her in a DOT approved ICS.
86. Use of non -mission related material is prohibited by any crewmember during any critical phase of flight. All non -mission related material will be stowed prior to initiating the _____.
87. An entry will be placed in AFTO 781A when the aircraft is _____.
responses: sprayed with insecticide; aerosol d -phenothrin- 2 percent (or equivalent.)
flown over water, under 1,000 feet above sea level for longer than 30 minutes

questions.question: 88. The aircraft loadmaster may deviate from load plans to facilitate ease of onload/offload ing of cargo, accommodate additional passengers, to alleviate unnecessary aircraft reconfiguration and if practical to load to optimum aircraft performance CG without submitting documentation.
89. Personnel will only be permitted to carry their basic combat load or individual issue of hazardous material when _____.
responses: the combat load or hazmat is carried in their rucksack
the combat load or hazmat is correctly marked and certified with a shipper u2019s declaration
given to the loadmaster before takeoff
they will engage an enemy force immediately upon arrival

questions.question: 90. The maximum altitude for emergency airlift of personnel will not exceed flight level _____.
91. Maximum altitude for floor loaded patients is flight level _____.
92. The following smoke detectors are required for home station/main operating base departures: One AV, all 4 IRU, _____ plus two others in the cargo compartment.
93. All passenger hand -carried items must be of a size to fit under the seat and must not obstruct the safety. Any item that does not fit under a seat or obstructs an aisle way will be ____.
responses: downloaded and transported on the next available aircraft
stowed with checked baggage and secured for flight
turned over to TMO/ITO for proper manifesting
secured with a carabineer clip to the sidewall

questions.question: 94. If no maintenance personnel are available and crew duties limit the availability of a crewmember, the engines may be started without someone outside the aircraft. If this option is used, ensure all crewmembers are thoroughly briefed.
95. The maximum FDP for a basic aircrew is _____ hours, (_____ hours when the autopilot is inoperative).
96. The maximum crew duty time for a basic aircrew is _____ .
97. Maximum CDT for an augmented aircrew is _____ hours.
98. For all missions, the latest allowable alert time is _____ hours after the expected alert time.
99. Do not taxi an aircraft within _____ of obstructions without wing walkers monitoring the clearance between aircraft and obstructions. With wing walkers, avoid taxi obstructions by at least _____.
100. During reverse taxi operations, obstacles greater than _____ tall require _____ of clearance from the aft end of the ramp in coplanar.
